page.title: 05The Vicar of Whittlesey 1
page.content: As the vicar of Whittlesey I look after three churches each with a congregation of about 100. The congregation is not all old people it is a mixture but there are more old people than young. The people come from all over Whittlesey though of course more people go to the church in their own parish. The parish stretches from Thorney to Pondersbridge which is about 6 miles, and from Kings Delph to Coats which is about 5 miles. The parish population is now about 10,000 people, of these only a very small percentage now attend church regularly each sunday. The churches are the Church of Saint Andrew and the Church of Saint Mary. They are to be found on the east and west sides of Whittlesey.
